See Amendment 12. "The person having the greatest Number of votes for President, shall be the President, if such number be a majority of the whole number of Electors appointed; and if no person have such majority, then from the persons having the highest numbers not exceeding three on the list of those voted for as President, the House of Representatives shall choose immediately, by ballot, the President." title: Revised Writ of Certorari Showing that Religious Discrimination and Reading Discrimination were involved. Can Someone be Co-President with 2 votes as 2 votes is greatest number in much law and Co-presidency was not dispensed with at the Constitutional Convention. Added the first 2 sentences to actual writ sent via mail.
subject: law
